title.narrative: OUTPUT 33 WASH-IN-SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Output 33: An additional 125,000 children in basic schools in 5 most deprived regions use Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in line with the Child Friendly Schools Model, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 009 : 54% of population have sustainable and equitable access to and use of basic sanitation services underpinned by improved hygiene practices and sustainable water services by 2016.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 33: An additional 125,000 children in basic schools in 5 most deprived regions use WASH services in line with the ChildFriendly Schools Model

description.narrative: A draft national costed strategy to provide WASH facilities and education programmes for all Ghanaian schoolchildren was developed and incorporated into the draft Education Sector Plan. Strategy elements demonstrated at scale included simple, low-cost handwashing facilities (500,000 schoolchildren); a menstrual hygiene management communication package and sustainable water and sanitation facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of children in basic schools with adequate WASH facilities in line with national Child Friendly School standards as a result of UNICEF interventions

actual.value: 2017:Draft strategy validated by stakeholders and expecting final National Costed strategy for WASH in Schools by 30th December
